resources:
KinesisPowersApp Type name... //Categories Quinéticos Percepción Extrasensorial Magia Otros // Psicokinesis Aerokinesis Consiste en la creación y dominio total del aire, esta es la más fácil de aprender después de la telekinesis. Los tres pasos o partes que la constituyen, son escalones muy grandes, y cada paso es más difícil que el anterior. Ejercicio 1 - Producción del Viento Utilizaremos el Psi-Wheel (cuya construcción se explica en el tema de la Telequinesis), pondremos el Psi-Wheel delante nuestro pero no lo moveremos a través de los conocimientos telekineticos, nos soplamos en la palma de la mano y asimilamos esa sensación, extendemos nuestra mano de manera que la palma de la mano quede dirigida hacia el psi Wheel, y haremos notar la sensación de viento que producimos antes en nuestra mano, al principio sentirás una pequeña brisa, pero poco a poco esa sensación irá aumentando, y veras como el psi Wheel se mueve por el viento. Ejercicio 2 - Dominio del Viento Dominar el viento es más difícil que producirlo, la mejor técnica de entrenar es coger una veleta de las que se ponen para indicar el sentido del viento, y que indique el sentido que tú quieras, para realizarlo haremos lo siguiente: Ponemos la veleta en la calle, ventana o cualquier sitio por el que pase el viento, ahora siente el viento y hazlo tuyo igual que con la psi Wheel, cuando lo sientas como parte de ti muévelo en el sentido que quieras, la veleta te servirá para saber si realmente el aire va hacia donde tú quieres. Ejercicio 3 - Oxigenación o Purificación del Aire Esta parte necesita mucha paciencia, velas y un bote lo más grande posible. La oxigenación del aire es la inserción de oxígeno en un aire falto de este, sabemos que si falta oxígeno, no podemos mantener encendida una llama, pues intentaremos mantener una vela encendida en un lugar cerrado, la llama consumirá oxígeno, si este se agota la llama se apagará, si mantenemos la llama encendida quiere decir que estamos aportando oxígeno. Para mantenerla encendida: Primero de todo encender la vela, meterlo en el bote cerrado y cronometra el tiempo que tarda en apagarse. Metemos la vela en el bote, la encendemos, y sin cerrar el bote vamos visualizando como en la llama se mete oxígeno, lo puedes visualizar como aire azul, y expulsa co2, lo puedes visualizar como aire negro, cuando lo tengas asimilado tomate el tiempo necesario, entonces visualizamos como el co2 que expulsa la llama va cambiando de color y se va convirtiendo en aire azul (oxígeno), cuando estemos listos taparemos el bote sin dejar de visualizar ese cambio, cronometra sin dejar de visualizar el tiempo que tarda la vela en apagarse, si tarda mas es que vas bien, intenta mejor día a día el tiempo, hasta llegar al punto en el que no se desaparezca. Ejercicio 4 - Creación del Aire La creación del aire es la parte más difícil, nos servirá para aumentar la presión en lugares cerrados: Llenamos un plato de agua, ponemos un trozo de corcho y encima de este le ponemos una vela pequeñita o un papel ardiendo, rápidamente lo tapamos con un vaso boca bajo, veremos como al consumirse el oxígeno el agua es absorbida por el vaso, pues ahora debemos sacarla aumentando la presión dentro del vaso:
 Visualizando un punto lleno de aire por ejemplo de color azul dentro del bote, que va aumentando de tamaño, el nivel de agua debe ir bajando, no desesperes si no lo consigues la primera vez, con la experiencia puedes ir probando a hinchar globos que están anudados ya aunque esto último es más difícil, ya que no puedes ver el interior del globo y es más difícil de visualizar. Atmokinesis Is the ability to manipulate the atmosphere via psychic means. A user of this ability can change the weather and can cause freak weather. This ability allows manipulation and creation of natural weather conditions, such as, rain, thunderstorms, snow etc(…)
 Atmokinesis often comes with a psychic restriction preventing manipulation of anything other than weather and climate patterns, as the capability to generate holes in the ozone layer, or the like, would pose the possibility of bringing harm to the user.
 This ability might be connected with Aerokinesis (manipulation of air) the control of the wind, Electrokinesis (manipulation of electricity), described as the control of the lightning in the clouds, and Hydrokinesis (manipulation of water), through the various forms of precipitation (rain, snow, sleet, hail). Esto es importante especialmente en las aplicaciones, estas deben empezar resolviendo UN SOLO problema y hacerlo muy bien, no trates de hacer una app “todóloga”, porque será confusa y mucho más difícil de hacer. • Inicia pensando en el problema, no en la solución, por ejemplo, no pienses en “Voy a hacer una app que ayude a las personas a reservar lugares en clubes nocturnos”, mejor piensa “¿Cuál es la parte más incómoda de ir a un club nocturno? Ah, tener que llamar antes para reservar, siempre olvido reservar”. Esto te guiará a brindar algo que la gente realmente quiera y/o necesite. Observa bien tu entorno para detectar problemas que puedas solucionar. • De preferencia (aunque no es obligación), crea un producto que resuelva un problema personal, algo que necesites pero que no exista o que en el mercado no sea lo suficientemente bueno todavía, esto te mantendrá enfocado en lograr tu objetivo, puesto que tu meta será solucionar algo que te beneficiará a ti también. • Si tu idea ya existe, no te desanimes, quiere decir que hay un mercado para ella. • Cuenta tu idea a amigos y personas que conozcas. Evalúa si realmente lo que tú crees que es un problema lo es o no. Importante, al menos al inicio NO PIDAS OPINIÓN DE TUS PADRES (Ellos siempre te dirán que la idea es buena o te dirán que te dejes de tonterías, pero digan lo que digan nublará tu punto de vista) 1 Enfócate En Un Solo Problema y Resuélvelo Muy Bien 2 Evalúa Tu Idea Con Personas Cercanas © 2017 JESUS ERNESTO VALDEZ ALMARAL, ALMARAL ENGINEERING • La opinión de tus amigos en general no es muy útil (O muy alentadores o muy negativos, no hay puntos medios), pero este ejercicio te dará un punto de partida y te ayudará a perder el miedo para entrevistar a desconocidos. • Crea una HIPÓTESIS acerca de tu producto y el problema que resuelve, por ejemplo: “El principal problema de ir a un club nocturno concurrido es tener que reservar con anticipación, mucha gente no lo hace por flojera o porque no le gusta contactar a otros para ese tipo de cosas”. • ESCRIBE UN CUESTIONARIO para que hagas las mismas preguntas a todos, el cuestionario te ayudará a conocer a tus futuros clientes, sus hábitos, sus problemas, y si tu hipótesis es real o solo está en tu mente. Guarda el cuestionario, lo necesitarás para después. • Puede ser tan sencillo como un bosquejo a mano en una libreta. • Muestra este prototipo a personas cercanas y a profesionales en desarrollo: diseñadores, programadores, etc. Esto, además de ayudar en la VALIDACIÓN de tu idea, te dará puntos de vista para saber si lo que quieres es realizable o no. • Una app muy buena para crear este tipo de prototipos es Pop (https://marvelapp.com/ pop/), te ayudará a crear un prototipo en cuestión de horas o incluso minutos sin necesidad de programación. • Entrevista a unas 5 PERSONAS y haz mejoras, ITERA si es necesario y repite el proceso hasta que estés a gusto con tu idea. • Este es un prototipo un poco más detallado, creado con alguna herramienta de software: Powerpoint, Photoshop, Keynote, Sketch, etc. 3 Crea Un Prototipo Básico 4 Crea Un Prototipo Intermedio © 2017 JESUS ERNESTO VALDEZ ALMARAL, ALMARAL ENGINEERING • Este prototipo va dedicado a tus POSIBLES CLIENTES, ¡Sal a la calle a mostrarlo! • Si cuentas con una Mac, te recomiendo especialmente hacer prototipos con Sketch App (https://www.sketchapp.com/), es un software relativamente barato y enfocado al diseño de apps y páginas web, puedes probarlo por 30 días y ver si te convence. • Otro software que te recomiendo (y es gratis para realizar este paso) es InVision, te
Claircognizance Is the ability for a person to acquire psychic knowledge without knowing how or why he or she knew it. The user can gain information about a person, object, place, or event through intrinsic knowledge, as in it just comes to the users mind. Exercise 1 - Hello blank fragment
//DICTIONARY AAAS Acronym for the American Association for the Advancement of Science (American Association for the Advancement of Science). Agency based in New York and that groups all the official sciences that exist in the world. In 1969, on proposal of the anthropologist Dr. Margaret Mead, parapsychology was accepted as science represented by the Parapsychologist Association, based on the quantitative studies carried out with the ESP phenomena carried out since 1927 by Dr. Joseph Banks rhine, in the Duke University, and those who later joined the research of PK (Psychokinesis). Absent Healing Healing that takes place when the healer is not in direct contact with the person to be healed. Abracadabra Kabbalistic voice that constitutes the formula of magic expression to which extraordinary powers are attributed and which means "Divine Expression". Tinnitus Ringing in the ears. Auditory sensations in absence of external stimulus. They can be interpreted as Paraphonic phenomena, voices from beyond the grave, etc. Acupuncture Traditional Chinese medical practice that involves sticking needles into specific locations on the body. Adept Esoterically it is the name that is designated to the person who is initiated in the world of magical knowledge and has come to know and to master two hermetic secrets of esotericism. In Alchemy the term is used to designate the person who has reached the end of his work. Absent Sitter A person, not present during a sitting, on whose behalf readings are given. See also Proxy Sitting. Fortune telling Ability to foresee future events or discover hidden things by means of Extrasensory Perception (ESP) directly or using as clairvoyant support. Letters, crystal ball, coffee grounds, pendulum, etc. Advocation System that consists of pronouncing a formula initiation by which a person declares himself a disciple and follower of an entity, teaching or hermetic philosophy. Aeromancy Divinatory art based on the air that is breathed. Akashic Records "Memories" of all experiences since the beginning of time, believed by some mystical doctrines to be stored permanently in a spiritual substance (Akasha). Agent Person who attempts to communicate information to another in an ESP experiment. The subject in a psychokinesis experiment. Person who is the focus of poltergeist activity. Soul Metaphysical essence of the human being that constitutes the Spiritual breath that activates the life of man. It is the Nephesh of the Hebrews and the Psyche of the Greeks. Alomancy Synonym of saltiness. It is understood by saltiness, the divination by means of salt. Hallucination Perception of something that does not materially exist and that occurs in the subject by disturbance of the senses. Alien Abduction Experience Reported experiences of being abducted by alien creatures, often into spacecraft. Abductees often experience lost time and suffer loss of memory. When memories are recovered, often using hypnotic regression, abductees may report that surgical operations were performed on them. See also temporal lobe activity. Amnesia Total or partial loss of memory. Angels Benevolent spiritual beings who help people in need. Artefact In parapsychology, false evidence of paranormal phenomena, due to some extraneous normal influence. Aquelarre Term derived from the basque voices Ake-Larren-Larrea, which means: meeting in the meadow of the goat. Witch meeting. Synonym of SABBAT. Aruspices Priests of ancient Rome whose mission consisted of predict the future through the viscera of the victims of the sacred sacrifices. Asynergy Alteration of the faculty of association of movements elementals during the performance of complex acts. Asitism Voluntary fasting that lasts sometimes indefinitely, especially in acts of great mysticism. Aura Emanation generally colored, perceived by certain clairvoyants, around the human body and sometimes, around animals and plants. Spontaneous self-combustion See Biopirogenesis. Autohypnosis Technique developed for the provocation of the hypnotic state produced by the individual himself. It is an autosuggestion. Self-description Notice that we receive, usually in dreams, from something that will happen to us. Autoscopy Inner vision or ability to see one's own internal organs of the body. Autosuggestion Psychic phenomenon in which our imaginative mind creates a fixed idea that takes shape and settles in our psyche in the form of obsession, until become a subjective reality influencing our personality. Bicorporeity Synonym of Bilocation. Bilocation Simultaneous presence of a person, in two different places. Parapsychology has shown that certain cases of bilocation are no more than cases of telepathy. Biofotogenesis Modification of the cellular tissues of the human organism that causes them to emit flashes of light of their own. Biopause The ability to control and neutralize biological functions. Biopirogenesis Biological self-production of fires in the person's own body who causes the combustion of the organism because of an internal ignition that manifested in the form of bluish flames that arise from the different natural orifices of the body and cause the Spontaneous Human Combustion (SHC). Biotic Synonym for thelergy; physical energy. Astrology A theory and practice which attempts to identify the ways in which astronomical events are correlated with events on earth (e.g., with an individual's personality and biography, or with social and political trends). Banshee In Gaelic belief, a female entity who heralds a death by groaning and screaming. Crystal ball Sphere or oval of crystal used in crystallomancy. Faraday camera It is a metal enclosure, cage or camera according to the uses, in which inside's electric or electromagnetic emissions can not penetrate. It was designed by the English physicist and chemist Faraday. PSI Field In addition to the gravitational, magnetic and electric fields the existence of a PSI field has been proposed internationally, which would explain the correlation between the physical factors that intervene in the paranormal (J.L. Jordán Peña). Zener Cards Card game consisting of five different forms: star, circle, waves (three parallel wavy lines), square and cross; the game consists of 25 letters. They were used by Dr. J.B. Rhine in his telepathy experiments and have become one of the most used instruments in scientific Parapsychology. Cartomancy Divination of the future through cards or cards. Haunted House Popular name received by Poltergeist cases. Cataplexia Physiological state of stupor motivated by fear that animals suffer because they have been placed in an unusual position in their usual way of life. Cenesthesia The ability to provoke internal hallucinations in the own body. This phenomenon usually occurs in cases of possession in which cenesthetically the individual believes to be devoured internally by an "evil entity" and suffers the consequences as if the hallucinations were real. Cenesthetic Concerning the feeling experienced by the individual of his own existence. Chakras According to Eastern philosophy they are neuralgic centers of the person or spiritual energy points located in the astral body that have correlation in the center of the spinal cord and in the nerve plexuses of the human body. Kinetic Term that identifies the science of movements. Psychic Surgery Relative surgical technique that allows a healer, a gifted, to be able to surgically intervene any pathological alteration without any instrument. An example of this are the famous psychic operations that are carried out in the Philippines and in Brazil. Clairvoyance Natural or acquired psychic power to being able to see through dense matter without distance obstacles or time. Clariaudience Psychic ability to be able to hear at any distance, including ultraphysical sounds. Criptesthesia Term devised by Charles Richet to designate the clairvoyance. At present it is in disuse. Cryptomnesia Paranormal access to the depths of the subconscious, to evoke memories and subliminal perceptions that are contained there. Astral Body A term used by occultists, spiritualists and theosophists to refer to a supposed "double" of the person's physical body. The astral body is believed to be separable from the physical body during astral projection (out of body experience) and at death. Cumberlandism It consists essentially in perceiving unconscious movements of a subject whose thought one wants to know. It was presented for the first time by the English illusionist and conjuror Cumberland. Quackery Practice of curing diseases by no means approved by legal medicine. System used by those who say they have special faculties to cure physical ailments. Quack Sensitive subject with faculties that are on the margin of Biology, which can still diagnose a disease, how it can cure, or alleviate imposition of hands, by suggestion, prayers, etc. (In this field there is a lot of fraud). Deja-Vu Traveling clairvoyance phenomenon whose etymology means "Already seen". It is created by neurological processes that produce a large intensification of consciousness, fact that provides the feeling of having been before in a certain place, perhaps in "another life", according to the followers of reincarnation's philosophy, based on the fact of prenatal awareness. Dermophilia Appearance on various points of the skin, in sensitive individuals, of certain signs, spots or drawings of paranormal origin. Dermograms Graphics, symbols or drawings marked on the skin because of an epidermal irritation, caused almost always by the rupture of the capillaries. Dermooptic Capacity that some people have to be able to appreciate optical images through their skin, especially the fingertips. Splitting State of division of the personality. It is the faculty of being able to move our astral body, to act in a place far from the physical body. Diapsychia Old denomination of the Telepathy. Charm A spell or object possessing magic power. Down Through Method of perception of Zener cards "down and through", used in ESP (Extra-Sensory Perception) in the quantitative experimentation of clairvoyance. Duke University Durham Study Center, North Carolina, United States of America (University) where the first official parapsychology laboratory was founded in 1930. Ecto-Coloplasmia Modeling phenomenon of ectoplasm by means of the unconscious, forming figures, faces and various objects. Ectoplasia Synonym of Telergy and Materialization. Term created by Myers in 1904 to define the materialized bioenergetic or teleneric substance. Ectoplasm Paranormal formation of a substance of unknown nature that usually emanates from the same mouth of the medium. Outpour Emanation of vitality attributable to the magnetism of body. Synonym for aura. Christian Science A religious healing movement founded by Mary Baker Eddy. Rejects orthodox medical practice. Automatic Writing Also called psychography; writing that some people in a semi-trance state can carry out, even being able to do foreign languages, totally unknown to the same subject. Eidetism Faculty that allows a subject to represent (by mnemic evocation) images with a high level of clarity or sharpness. Elohim God's proper name and for which he is still designated in Freemasonry. Escotography Proposed denomination for the photographic images printing phenomenon on sensitive emulsion, in the absence of light and without the aid of a camera or any optical device. ESP Abbreviation for Extra-Sensory Perception. In Spanish it is known by the initials P.E.S. o Extrasensory Perception. Spectrum Apart from its physical acceptance, which refers to a range of frequencies, is also used to designate an apparition or the phenomenon known as ghosts. Spiritualism Doctrine that starts from the basis of a philosophical scientific and moral background, that the human being is made up of three elements: body, spirit and a link called perispirit. Parapsychology studies spiritualism in depth, especially those mediums of physical effects. Spiritualists Relative to spiritualism. Stigmata Figurative or imitative skin signs that appear on the human body. They are alterations of psychosomatic character. Etrobia Walk through the air Levitation of a person without human intervention. Exteriorization Simultaneous appearance of a person in two different places and at the same time. Extrasensory That goes beyond the physical senses. Extrasensory Faculties It refers to those faculties that allow us to enter in contact or being subjects of paranormal experiences, manifested through different ways to those of the physical senses. Fading Sudden phenomenon of the momentary disappearance of the radiesthetic effluvia. Ghosts Appearances, unfolding, bilocations, astral projection, etc. It can also be a telepathic hallucination as explained in almost all treatises of Parapsychology. PSI Phenomenon They are all the phenomena that occur as a result of the PSI action in all concepts. It covers all extrasensory perception C.E.S.P. Knowledge PSI-GAMMA and PSI-KAPPA. Physical phenomena Synonym for objective phenomena. Paranormal phenomena They are the usual, logical, whether psychological or physical, due to forces that seem intelligent, or to faculties unknown yet of the human mind. Objective Phenomena or PSI-KAPPA (PK) Are those phenomena of a paranormal nature manifested through effects of physical order: psychokinesis, ectoplasmia, psychophonies, etc. Subjective phenomena or PSI-GAMMA (PG) They are those phenomena of paranormal nature, manifested through effects of mental order, of our own psyche: telepathy, clairvoyance, precognition, etc. Fitomagnetism It is said of the magnetism of the vegetable kingdom. Fitometragraphy Obtaining spiritual photographs of beings belonging to another dimension and photographs of the so-called astral body of people split into extracorporal experiences. Photoforia This voice has been proposed for the genesis of paranormal light phenomena (bright flashes, bright spheres, etc.). Photogenesis Production of paranormal lights. Photopsia Visual hallucination of elementary character. The subject perceives flashes of light or sees the whole field of vision dyed a single color. Unconscious Forces Potentials catalyzed by the medium in order to perform the proposed phenomenon. Geomancy Divination procedure by examining the projecting figures formed on a table or a sieve, earth, dust, etc. Glossolalia Phenomenon in which a medium under trance speaks or writes in a foreign language, which ignores in normal state. Gnosis Phenomenon of acquisition of knowledge in a state of mysticism by ecstatic way, without mediating any intellectual or pedagogical system. Geoecia Name by what is called Black Magic. Graphology Science that allows to determine the character, health, trends etc. of an individual, through the study of his writing. Grimoire Generic name of the book used by the Magi and occultists as a manual. Guru Spiritual instructor, also called master. Hagiography Studies made to the lives of the saints. Hematograms Strange drawings, symbols and graphics marked in the skin (or on canvases that have been attached to it) by blood effusion through the pores. Heteroscopy GIt is usually an hallucination. In Parapsychology refers to the vision of the internal organs of another person. Hyaloscopy or Catopthomancy Divinatory procedure by means of a crystal ball, mirror or any reflective surface. Hiloplasty Paranormal action that is characterized by materialization and dematerialization of physical bodies, which can thus penetrate hermetic enclosures. Hiloscopy Voice proposed by Boirac for those paranormal phenomena in which matter interacts with the mind, as is the case of dowsing. Hyperacusis Hyperesthesia limited to the perception of sounds. Hyperaphy Tactile hyperesthesia, very marked epidermal sensitivity. Hyperesthesia Unusual sensory acuity in special circumstances. The hyperesthetic perception in an amazing sharpness that can reach our normal sensations. Hypergeusia Term referring to the hyperesthetic sensitivity to recruitment of gustatory stimuli. Hypermnesia Phenomenon of exaltation of memory, produced in trance state and by hypermnesic persons with faculties to sharpen the psyche, up to remember with the most accurate details facts and knowledge lost in the memory of the time. Hipermnesoglosia Capacidad de recordar, con todo su vigor primitivo, una lengua olvidada. Hyperosmia Hyperesthetic sensitivity of subliminal olfactory uptake. Hypersensitive See medium, paragnosta, etc. Hypnosis Provoked artificial dream. Suggestion and auto-suggestion are related to hypnosis, but without the subject having to be necessarily asleep. Hypnotism Set of phenomena that constitute hypnosis. Hipotaxic Semi-hypnotic state, technique similar to that of fascination. IAO Etymologically, breath of life. Ideofony Reception of music, bells, voices, noises, etc. without apparent cause and of paranormal origin. Ideoplasty Paranormal faculty attributed to thought and that exercises an action on the matter. They are forms of thought that sometimes impress, for example, sensitized photographic plates. Delusion False interpretation of a reality. Infestation In houses or places. Synonym of poltergeist Immortality Property that has a being to continue existing indefinitely, eternally, without corruption or death. Intuition Perception or instant knowledge of a truth or idea without the participation of any reasoning. Invocation Any prayer is like an invocation. Jettatura Name given to malign influences or negatives produced through the look of the Sorcerer. Synonym of Evil eye. Ju-Ju Fetish name (amulet) used in the West African tribes. Kamarupa According to the Spiritualists, entity or operator, provocateur of incoherent and funny disorders in the course of sessions. Kappa In Parapsychology it is the term derived from Greek meaning "matter". See Psi-Kappa. Karma Absolute universal law of compensatory retribution between cause and effect based on the mechanism of action-reaction. Kinesis Greek voice that means movement and in medicine it designates the action of the central nervous system manifested through the muscles. In Parapsychology is applied to the term Psychokinesia (Psycho-Kinesia) to define the group of paraphysical phenomena in which the mind inflicts dynamically on matter and it sets it in motion. Letargy Continuous and pathological sleep. Levitation Lifting of heavy objects in particular of the human body without intervention of any kind of force or physical agents. Lycanthropy From the Greek Lycos, "wolf", and Anthropos, "man". Psychic disorder, a variety of zoanthropy, in which the patient believes he is a wolf. Litomagnetism Magnetism that certain minerals possess and some precious stones Litotelergy Mysterious launch of stones in several directions without observable physical cause. Logurgy Certain healers are considered to be loggis and surgeons who work by means of the power of the mind. Logurgy is in charge of study said phenomenology. Lucidity Popular term that indicates clairvoyance or telepathy. Mancies Divinatory techniques, some very ancient, most of them obtained by different means, such as: the crystal ball, the stripes of the hand, the letters, etc. Spiritualist Manifesto Act by which the spirit reveals its presence. Materializations Synonym of ectoplasm. Alleged formations of isolated organs or complete beings, sometimes humanoids, animals, etc. Meditation Mental process of reflection that allows through observation and analysis, knowing the essence of concrete things, or abstract speculation Medium mediumship Mediumship Spiritualists consider medium to every person who in Trance state can communicate with spirits, which inhabit another dimension. Mind Intellectual power of the soul that encompasses the designs, the thought, the purposes and the will. Talking Table (Tiptology) Table normally tripod, used to obtain communications with the supraphysical world in the spiritualistic sessions. Metaphysics Part of philosophy, which deals with being as such, of its properties, principles and primary causes. Metagnomy Synonym for clairvoyance. Touch Metagnomy It is about supernormal knowledge through the touch. Synonym of Psychoscopy or psychometry. Metapsychic Science that studies all kinds of physical phenomena and psychophysicists who exceed the limits of normal consciousness due to the forces that seem intelligent or to unknown faculties of the mind. (Charles Richet). Metasomoscopy Faculty that have some sensitives that allow them to see inside the human body. Mimicry Property that some animals and plants possess to change shapes and colors resembling other beings, or certain inanimate objects among those who live. Monition Manifestation, generally vague and affective, of a paranormal awareness. It is a spontaneous extrasensory perception. Monoideism State of mind when it is occupied by a single idea. Pneumophonia Phenomena of paraphonic character (emission of voices and musical melodies) that the spiritualists attribute to the direct action of the operators. Necromancy Invocation to the dead to know the future, whatever the method is used. Nimbo Halo, fringe, circle or luminous crown, which surrounds the head of a divinity or saint. Evocative object It is the object that the sensitive one places between his hands or before his front, to give way to the manifestation of extrasensory perceptions in relation to it. Occultism Science, or school of thought, from the middle ages, that study the mysteries of nature at the same time as the psychic powers latent in the human being. In the popular language Occultism is equivalent to magic. Odic It is equivalent to energy, strength; with this term Baron Karl von Reichenbach (1788-1869) came to explain the existence of the human aura and some other psychobiological phenomena. Brain waves Electric rhythms generated in the nervous tissue of the brain. It has been classified into four ranges: Alpha of 8 to 12 cycles / second; Beta frequencies greater than 13 cycles / second; Delta 1-4 cycles / second; and Theta of 4-8 cycles / second. Mental Waves Supposed waves emitted by the brain, constituted in the support of telepathic communications. Oniric It is said of how much it relates to dreams and certain imaginative situations of an unconscious nature. Oniromancy Divination procedure through dreams. Art of knowing how to interpret dreams. Mental Orientation In dowsing, orientation of the mind towards the object of the search or investigation. Osmogenesis Production of aromatic substances of paranormal origin. Ouija Name derived from affirmative conjunctions of two languages: the French word Oui and the German Ja, both mean "yes". Is the instrument consisting of a circular "master" or small wooden board with mobility to move on a surface on which all the letters of the alphabet and numbers from 0 to 9 are. Sheeps EIn parapsychology it is the name given to the sensitive people who show a good predisposition to undergo the Experimentation ESP. Palingenesis Regeneration, resurrection, reincarnation, transformation, renovation. Pandemonium This term defines the concrete fact in which an avalanche or set of noises is produced in a house at a certain time and that causes, suddenly, a total disorder in a mysterious way. The difference with the poltergeist, is that the Pandemonium has malefic character. Pantomnesia It is said of the memory of the unconscious. Parabiothermia Parabiological phenomenon that consists in controlling paranormally and at will body temperature. Paracardism Parabiological phenomenon that consists in controlling at will blood circulation and heart rate, at the precise moment. Parasciences Any field of human knowledge that try to analyze aspects of nature that are inaccessible to the current scientific method: like Parapsychology, Ufology, etc. Paragnosta It refers to a sensitive person who has an unusual capacity for extrasensory perception. Paranormal Term devised by W. Carrington to replace the supernormal term totally in disuse. Parapsicobiophysic Synonym term of parapsychology referring to the materialistic form of knowledge of paranormal phenomena, that from the agnostic perspective, is studied in some Eastern European countries. Parapsychology According to Dr. J. B. Rhine, Parapsychology is the branch attached to psychology, and deals with studying psychic, psychophysical, and paraphysicians. Parapsychology is the branch of knowledge that investigates those interrelationships between man and his means: biological, physical, and social. (Currently it is also called Parapsicobiofísica). Paratherapy Any phenomenon that is linked to the healers, psychic surgeons, etc. Radiesthetic pendulum Species of plumb or metal pendulum used by the dowser to find what you are looking for. Extrasensory perception (ESP) External fact without the intervention of any meaning known or conceivable. It is what the human being captures or receives through sensory channels or abnormal senses. In English E.S.P. (extra sensory perception). English acronyms are accepted throughout the world and are usually never translated. Pyromancy Divination by means of fire. Pyrovasia Faculty that certain people have to walk barefoot on the embers. P.K. (PSI-KAPPA) Psychokinesis. It is the direct influence exerted by a subject on a physical system without intervening instrument or physical energy known or conceivable. Pneumotofony Oral communication, of the spirits without the intervention of the voice of the medium. Pneumatography Direct writing of the spirits without the intervention of the medium's hand. Poltergeist An exclusively parapsychological term that corresponds to the German voice that means: "noisy elf". It is called like this to a wide range of Paraphysical phenomena (rarely parabiological) that are always linked to a place (homes, cemeteries, temples, etc.). Some of the facts registered in this type of manifestation have been: Litotelergy, Raps, Teleplasties, Telekinesis of furniture or heavy objects, ghosts, voices and paranormal noises. They seem to associate to the presence is a sensitive, often in adolescent age. They have also received the name of haunted houses or infestation. Postcognition Synonym of retrocognition. Perception of past events. Precognition Paranormal perception of an event that has not happened yet. Premonition Vague warning, generally, regarding the future or a future event. Coven A group of witches. Psychobulia Unconscious capacity that has a gifted to intelligently directing his telergy Psychokinesis Alleged action of the mind on a physical evolution system. Psychophonies Recordings on virgin tape in any tape recorder, or any other type of magnetic or optical support, of human voices, whispers, noises, music, bells, etc. of ignored origin. (Also called Paraphonies). Although the distinction between the terms paraphonies and psychophonies is practically null, the most appropriate name for the The phenomenon would be the paraphony. Psychography Appearance of a writing on a blackboard, wall, paper, etc. that could not be done by normal methods. It is of paranormal origin. Psychometry Synonym for psychoscopy. In parapsychology this term is used to designate the E.S.P. that some sensitive people have while hold in their hands any object that has belonged to the person he is looking for. Psychorrhagia Liberation of telergy or of certain energies and unconscious forces. Psychoscopy Clairvoyant faculty that possess some sensitive, that having a witness in your hands, such as a handkerchief, a pen, etc., will make them relate mentally with the owner of that object and you will obtain the necessary information. Psychotronics Synonym of Parapsychology; term used in the old socialist or communist countries. Quirology Art of knowing the character of a person by the observation of their hands. Palmistry It is a divinatory art through study or analysis of the stripes of the hand, according to universally accepted rules. Rabdomancy It is divination by means of a stick or cane. It is of ancient origin and is the forerunner of modern Dowsing. Radiation Energetic emissions that can have oscillatory nature. Dowsing It is the art of catching by means of a rod or pendulum, springs, treasures, things buried, lost, etc. this is due to the extrasensory perception of the individual. Raps English word that designates unusual noises that occur without explainable cause. Reincarnation According to Spiritism and many religions, return of the spirit to bodily life; plurality of existences. Retrocognition Knowledge of past events or experiences out of the memory of the individual and that could not be known by the normal sensory channels. SEIP Acronyms of the Spanish Society of Parapsychological Investigations. This society is chaired by Pedro Amorós (Researcher in Instrumental Transcommunications) and is based in Alicante (Spain) and its research field is international. Sematology Synonym of tiptology. Sensitive Person who has special faculty to experience an infinity of paranormal phenomena. Simulation Many paranormal phenomena can be simulated or tricks. Mystical Sounds Certain sounds perceived during the meditation. Telepathic suggestion Telebulia, transmission of the will at a distance. Takinesis Fast, close movements of various objects produced by the medium. Tarot Deck composed of 78 cards of Egyptian origin and that are used for prediction. Telebulia It is said of the telepathic suggestion. Telekinesis Displacement of objects without observable physical cause or known. Telehypnosis Hypnotic induction from a distance. Telepathy Transmission of thought at a distance. Teleplasty Synonym of ectoplasmia. Objectivation of forms. Telergy Physical or psychophysical force put into play in many acts of telepathy. Curse Words spoken or written in order to influence others paranormally, causing them harm. Termogenesis Energy causing and responsible for fires within a house, business, office, etc. usually caused by the telergy. Witness In dowsing, body of the same nature as the wanted. Tiptology Means of communication of the spirits by means of percussions or blows, sometimes imperfect, due to its slowness. Emptying Molds representing hands and arms obtained on paraffin, clay or any other plastic substance and whose formation has been achieved always in a totally paranormal way. Dowsing Rod They are two rods of flexible material, joined by an end and whose function is to amplify and make sensitive the unconscious movements of the hands, in its precise moment, in the course of the dowsing investigations. Foretell Predict. Clairvoyant In parapsychology a clairvoyant is a person with faculties of proven clairvoyance. Xenoglossia Locution of foreign languages that were never learned. Xilomancy Divination made by means of wood. Dowser It is said of the person with faculties for dowsing. The people trained to locate groundwater wells were commonly known. Old name for the dowser, now completely obsolete. Zener Name by which the letters called PES in the statistical analysis of certain extrasensory perception phenomena. Zombie A corpse that has been partly brought back to (soul-less) life by magic.
